intro: Allantodia dulongjiangensis, commonly known as the Dulongjiang allantodia, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, umbellate inflorescence. The plant has small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
